definitions.definition: A small platform, being or resembling a literal soapbox, on which a person stands in order to give an impromptu speech or espouse his or her views.
examples: The madman obtained a soapbox which he stood on at the corner of Broadway and Wall street, to shout out his prophecy of the end of the world.

definitions.definition: A platform or outlet, such as a media platform, that a person uses to express his or her opinions.
examples: The politician used Twitter as his soapbox .
Please stop using council meetings as your own personal soapbox .

definitions.definition: A figurative means of talking repeatedly or at length about one's opinions on one's pet topic.
examples: He's been on his soapbox all day about the new football coach.
His soapbox is the lack of public toilets in the city.

definitions.label_groups: derogatory , especially in phrases such as 'on/off one's soapbox'

main_definition: ( literally ) A crate for packing soap.
secondary_definitions: A small platform, being or resembling a literal soapbox, on which a person stands in order to give an impromptu speech or espouse his or her views.
( figuratively , often pejorative ) A platform or outlet, such as a media platform, that a person uses to express his or her opinions.
( derogatory , especially in phrases such as 'on/off one's soapbox' ) A figurative means of talking repeatedly or at length about one's opinions on one's pet topic.
